captions.en: Eat on the side where others won't notice.
Hello, please have a seat. Sorry for the wait.
Just grab a couple of books.
Would you like something to drink?
I was waiting for you, and then I thought we could order together.
Sure, let's order.
Excuse me, boss.
Hello.
Can we see the menu, please?
I saw on the billboard behind you that there's a cinnamon latte, which seems delicious.
Really? Want to give it a try?
Sure.
Why not?
Sure.
If you don't mind,
we can share a piece of cake.
No problem, you can have it.
I feel like we chose a really cold day to meet.
Yes, I'm actually quite cold.
It's really cold outside, I suppose.
Especially the heavy rain.
And next week,
the whole week will be really cold.
Yes, there's a cold front recently.
I saw the weather anchor sharing a piece of knowledge.
He said some people say,
"I don't feel cold at home."
"I feel fine staying at home on weekends."
"I don't feel cold at home."
And he said it's because it's just the first day of cold.
The buildings haven't felt the cold yet.
He said the building has its own temperature,
and the building hasn't felt cold yet.
So, you still feel warm at home.
But in two days, the building will also feel cold.
So, at that time, you'll understand
what it means when home is colder than outside.
This is a cold knowledge, right?
Yes.
A cold knowledge with double meanings.
Should we introduce ourselves?
Oh, yes. I forgot about that.
You go first.
Sure, I'll go first. My name is Yang Yang.
And I'm 35 years old this year.
Currently, I work at an internet company.
I mainly handle compliance and standard-related work.
Compliance?
Yes, mainly related to product compliance.
It's not financial compliance.
Yes.
So, you work in finance, right?
No, actually, my good friend works in financial compliance.
I think his job requires a lot of precision, and it can be quite controversial.
And especially during year-end, there are various challenges.
He's like guarding and overseeing the company.
It's quite a critical role for the company's compliance.
That's interesting.
I'm Wang Yang.
Wang Yang, like vast ocean?
Yes, it sounds poetic.
So, you're 35 years old, which means you were born in 1987.
I was born in 1986.
I just turned 35 two days ago.
Oh, happy belated birthday!
I'm from Shanxi, Taiyuan.
Shanxi has delicious noodles.
They have a variety of noodle dishes in Shanxi.
And we have Shanxi aged vinegar.
Sounds like a great place.
Is that a complete self-introduction?
Very complete. How did you know I was just thinking...
I wanted to say...
Your self-introduction was exceptionally thorough.
It made me a bit nervous too.
I'm Wang Yang, like vast ocean.
The second thing I said is that I'm 35 years old.
I'm from Jiangxi.
We've got one person from Shanxi and one from Jiangxi.
And I work in media.
I handle public relations and events.
Public relations, I see.
Like organizing parties and events?
Yes, things like parties, press conferences, and forums.
Got it, I think I understand.
It's in the arts direction?
Yeah, something like that.
So, you have an arts background?
Yes.
Great.
Artistic, huh?
I scored low on the exams.
Don't be so modest. I think...
art is an essential part of human culture.
Thank you.
We ordered two cups, right?
Yes, two cups.
Both are the same.
Both are the same.
So, compliance is mainly related to legal matters, right?
Not just that.
We also pay attention to product performance.
And there are some features related to privacy.
And some technical compliance issues.
So, you studied science or engineering?
No, I studied humanities.
I studied philosophy.
Philosophy?
Yes, that's right.
Where did you study philosophy?
I studied philosophy of science and technology.
It's a combination of humanities and sciences, sort of.
And it mainly focuses on philosophical questions related to technology.
That's interesting. It's a completely new field to me.
It must be fascinating. Philosophy is such a broad subject.
Indeed, philosophy has a wide range of applications.
Anyway, philosophy is a field with endless possibilities.
But the skills in critical thinking and discernment it cultivates might be even more valuable.
I believe it develops a certain type of thinking in individuals.
A mode of thinking based on speculation and reasoning.
I think that could be more important.
Could you briefly introduce your work experience?
Sure. After graduation...
I worked in Beijing for two years.
I had a hobby of playing with model aircraft since I was young.
During my student years, I also participated in some competitions.
After graduation, I worked for the supervisory department.
In the Civil Aviation Radio Model Sports Management Center.
It's quite a long name, and they manage many things.
Aeronautics and Astronautics Department?

pinyin: guó jiā tǐ yù zǒng jú
captions.en: No, it's the General Administration of Sport of China.
Civil Aviation Radio Model Sports Management Center.
Wow, that's a mouthful.
Yes, it's quite a long name and covers a lot of areas.
It oversees the entire country's radio-controlled aviation sports.
It's related to the model aircraft content I used to play with as a kid.
That must be fulfilling your childhood dream.
Yes, it's quite enjoyable.
You are lucky, you know?
Always being accompanied by your interests.
Oh, yes.
And then, in 2015...
I moved to Shenzhen and joined a drone company.
Back in Beijing, the air pollution was particularly severe in those years.
Every year, it felt like we couldn't see the outside world when we opened the door.
So, at that time, I thought...
joining a drone company would be interesting.
Because drones were becoming more popular at the time.
It was the kind of period when you couldn't see the outside world.
And at that time, I thought...
I wanted to move to a place with a better environment.
Personally, I really like the sea.
So, I came to Shenzhen, by the seaside.
I think it's quite nice here.
When I first arrived in Shenzhen...
I was amazed by the blue sky...
...and the white clouds.
You probably wouldn't see such weather in northern cities, right?
I think you're cold.
I'm super cold, I'm even shivering.
I think you've been shivering the whole time.
Could you ask your boss if there are any blankets here?
If there are, could you get us two?
And do you have any hand warmers?
We could use four of them.
So, do you see Shenzhen as a place for long-term development?
That's how I felt before.
Shenzhen is good at retaining talents.
It's true; I find Shenzhen attractive for long-term settlement.
Not necessarily talent, but it's good for people to settle down.
So, is the workplace mostly male-dominated?
We're an internet company, and I work in the R&D department.
So, you can imagine that there are fewer female employees.
Were you in Shenzhen since 2015?
Yes, I've been in Shenzhen since 2015.
So, it's been around six or seven years.
Right.
Have you had a girlfriend in Shenzhen?
Definitely.
You're asking these questions so quickly.
Just asking casually.
Of course, I have.
Not going to elaborate on that, right?
Let's move on from this question.
Do you want me to elaborate?
No, I won't go into details. It depends on whether you want to share.
You seem nervous; you're drinking water again.
Are you still feeling cold?
The water has gotten cold.
So, why did you break up?
I think the fundamental reason is that we had different visions for the future.
Our long-term goals were not aligned.
We had different visions for the future.
.Ir
Our long-term goals were different.
Or maybe it's about how we understood life.
Or perhaps it's about your approach to life.
It's not exactly an attitude, though.
It's more about how you want to live your life.
So, what are your life goals?
Your ideal state of living.
I think it's about living a happy and interesting life.
What about her point of view?
For her, living a happy and interesting life might not be the same for all.
She's a Shenzhen girl, and they focus on making money.
Making money.
Making money.
But I don't think it's wrong to focus on making money.
But I believe there's nothing wrong with that either.
You're also making money in Shenzhen, right?
It depends on the proportion of how you allocate it.
Right.
So, what's your approach to life?
This kind of spending money.
Or the investment in enjoying life.
How much proportion would you allocate to spend on wasteful things?
Like, for example, the things that make you happy.
What makes you happy.
Maybe it's skydiving.
Or buying an aircraft model.
But for her, happiness is saving money to buy a house.
Some people earn money for happiness.
And some people spend money for happiness, right?
I get it.
So, are you the type who earns money for happiness?
No, I'm the type who spends money.
So, you are the one who spends money for happiness.
You should be very happy, right?
She earns money, you spend money.
But it's not to the extent of joint property yet.
Isn't that complementary?
It's not to the level of sharing all the finances.
I think...
There are many things you'll...
Is she extreme? Because I feel...
She's not that extreme.
Earning money is quite normal, right?
Yes, exactly.
You're also working hard to earn money, but for example...
For instance, you mentioned skydiving or doing something else.
Some people might think, "Wow, I think this person is worth it."
You had a great experience.
And I would like to do that too.
But some people might think it's a waste of money.
Why?
It's risky and a waste of money, right?
It's just that we may have different views on the same thing.
Different perspectives.
Significant differences.
For example, when girls buy handbags worth 20-30 thousand,
you might wonder what's the meaning of spending so much on a bag.
But actually, I can understand.
Right, I can understand.
It's about mutual understanding.
I can understand.
Mutual understanding.
You can understand her desire for a cure-all.
And she can understand your desire to soar in the sky.
Right, right.
So, you haven't been together for a long time, right?
It hasn't been more than a year.
It's almost around that time.
Because I think this should be quite obvious.
The foreseeable differences are relatively easy to find.
It's not like some hidden problem.
The problem may be discovered.
But if we look at it from a time perspective,
At the beginning,
you might be more accommodating.
For example, you might
have more tolerance, right?
But as time goes on,
you might focus more
on what you want yourself.
That might grow a bit.
So, after saying so much,
I mean...
I didn't say much about you.
I only asked a section.
So, have you only had this one girlfriend in Shenzhen?
I don't believe it.
Definitely not just one.
So, for me...
So, how was your last relationship?
We broke up last year, right?
So, what happened in your last relationship?
How many relationships have you had?
I'm not prying into your affairs.
I'm just trying to see if, you know...
If the emotional rhythm of people our age in Shenzhen is similar.
It's like social research.
So, what's your rhythm like?
Just checking if it's similar to yours.
Just looking to see if it's similar to mine.
Just talking about me, right?
It's not just me, even in my last relationship with you.
It's been almost a year since we broke up.
So, why did you break up in your last relationship?
In my last relationship,
the details were not very clear.
It was more like a clash of personalities.
So, your last breakup was due to incompatible personalities, right?
No, I'm asking you.
Because your last relationship ended due to incompatible personalities.
Yes, it can be considered as incompatible personalities, right?
Many people say that incompatible personalities might be an excuse
or some kind of...
I totally understand that.
But it really was the reason.
Because it permeated through many details.
And those details aren't something like,
"Just tolerate it a bit."
"Just be more understanding."
"You can get past it."
It means you've had similar experiences, right?
Isn't every breakup due to incompatible personalities?
Can all the reasons be attributed to incompatible personalities?
So, do you think dating in Shenzhen
is an easy thing?
By "easy," I mean,
do you think your living environment
or your work environment
can provide you with many
opportunities to meet the opposite sex?
There are very few opportunities to meet the opposite sex in the work environment.
In my line of work,
most of my colleagues are male.
In the company, right?
And some of my external work
is mostly with older people.
There are very few opportunities to meet suitable women, right?
Suitable...professionally speaking.
Suitable in terms of age.
Have you ever thought about this?
What if there were more guys
and more boyfriends or husbands?
How would that change your current life?
Do you think it would be better or worse?
I hope it would be better.
Of course,
everyone hopes for the better.
Right.
But I guess you've also hesitated
because there may have been some, you know,
not very ideal examples around you.
But I think that's what you have to give in.
You'll have to sacrifice some of your time
to deal with another person
and another family's matters.
If there's another person coming in
to disrupt your stable, happy, and comfortable life,
it might not necessarily lead to a better outcome, actually.
There's definitely some risk involved.
Do you think many girls have such thoughts nowadays?
I'd like to ask, do guys think the same way?
Yes.
Right.
It's like...
Actually, I was just exploring a question with you.
It's about the issue of trust between people.
Why is it about trust?
Because you don't trust this person
and what they can bring to you.
And sometimes,
I don't think it's
our own problem.
I don't know if you think that sometimes I tend to be idealistic.
I'm not sure if you think I'm a bit idealistic sometimes.
I think maybe I am sometimes.
That idealism is about
everyone hoping to add points
and if your idealism is like,
"I just hope he can add points for me
and I won't have to subtract my points to compensate for his,"
of course, that's the best, but it's not possible.
That's a bit idealistic.
I think the core problem is,
why do you want to be with someone in life?
I think the core problem is,
why do you want to be with someone in life?
Hey, you said why?
Actually, this answers the question of marriage.
Why do people get married?
It's like why people need a companion to accompany them.
Can you explain this from the perspective of technological philosophy?
Not to study this person, ah.
This is beyond the scope of this study.
How do you see this issue?
Well, I think, how should I put it,
Two people living together is definitely better than one person.
Right.
For example, if two people share the burden of a family,
it's definitely lighter than one person.
So, your burden is definitely smaller.
But at the same time,
they will encroach on some of your things.
Have you ever thought about
what reasons would lead you to decide to get married one day?
What traits does that person possess
that make you determined to say, "This is the one,"
"I want to marry her, that's perfect"?
If I ever get married, I think it's because
I want to be with this person for a lifetime.
That's probably it.
And what qualities or that moment of excitement
make you feel like she's the one?
That instant determination and courage,
what value does she bring to your life?
What makes you think, "This is the one"?
Surely, it's not just a momentary action and courage
that leads to this outcome.
This is definitely more rational,
considering it's a long-term commitment, right?
It's quite prudent.
Because,
it definitely involves a long-term commitment.
So, I'm a bit cautious about it.
After all, it's like signing a long-term contract, right?
This will be quite troublesome in the future.
Future...
I think you've hit the nail on the head for men.
It means you still care about this matter.
It means you still care about this matter.
It's quite troublesome for the future.
It means you still value this matter.
If you think this person is light and insignificant,
you wouldn't think this way, right?
So, your ideal is...
What kind of person do you want, specifically?
To be more concrete.
For example, I think I'm emotionally sensitive.
I'm quite sensitive.
Right.
And then, I tend to...
Of course, my emotions
are not like a roller coaster ride.
But sometimes, I may feel a bit down
because of a tiny thing that you might not even notice.
Because this is a very personal behavior, you see.
It's not something that others can necessarily know.
Because of this, I might be a bit sentimental.
It's because this is a very personal behavior, you know?
When you feel emotionally down, others might not understand.
And sometimes, I may get sentimental, you know?
And sometimes, I might become fragile.
So, I hope this person can emotionally support me.
Actually, I value a person's emotional value to me.
This person always brings sunshine and a sense of peace.
He won't drag me down with him.
But most men are usually reserved, right?
Yes.
So, I think this is why, in many of my past relationships,
right?
I started to deduct points for these men later on.
Because, you know, for many girls,
they may think, "He just doesn't understand me."
You think about so many things,
and you might think this is a common flaw among many women.
That is, you might feel like he doesn't get you.
But sometimes, you have to admit
that, indeed,
it's not all men,
but some men,
or maybe ex-boyfriends,
they indeed might have thought,
"Can't you even think of this?"
"Can't you even do this?"
Such things might happen.
So,
it's like he really didn't pay attention,
and you might think, "Why does he deliberately ignore it?"
Then, I will feel like you are not really focused on me.
Even though it's something you should think about when you are with me.
But he might really say something like,
"I really didn't think about it."
Or, "I thought about it,
but I really couldn't think of it."
"Really couldn't think of it."
Maybe it's because his heart is not here.
Right.
And then, I would think,
Right, just like you said,
"Why can't you even think about it
when you put in so much effort?"
His heart is not here.
That's it.
So, do you think this expectation is too high in this regard?
I don't think it's too high.
Different people might have different peculiarities.
Do you think you might be a bit demanding in relationships?
I don't think so.
Really?
Really?
Yes.
Why do I feel like you are?
How can I have this feeling?
There's no reason, you know?
No, no, it's just
a very casual intuition.
You don't need to worry about it.
I casually asked.
I think I am quite tolerant of girls.
I think
I'm pretty laid-back.
I can compromise on many things.
So, you
Do you think you are indifferent in relationships?
For example,
did your ex-girlfriends feel that
they thought you were quite

so there are many subtle
observations I can't make, which people call "insensitive."
I think I am the type that is quite carefree and easy-going.
Actually, I quite enjoy that kind of
relaxed lifestyle.
Many things don't matter to me.
And I don't want to pay too much attention to details.
I feel comfortable in this state.
So, what is something about girls that you can't accept?
If you can only mention one thing.
Can't accept
For example, would you say, "This girl is too materialistic"?

for you to feel unacceptable.
It's more like this, or

I find it hard to bear.
It's like life is too
too unstructured,
something like that.
Something like this.
Do you have a more specific point?
You just mentioned these two points, and I probably don't like them both.
Finally, I found a chance to say one.
Yes, that's it.
I said the first one is materialism.
It's being overly concerned with material things.
Other than what I said, you can add one more.
Don't always try to please me.
Because what you said is accurate.
I left a little for you to say.
Let me think about what I can't accept.
From your response speed,
it shows that you are quite accommodating.
Because some people are very critical,
or some people are very clear-cut,
they don't need to think.
I have some friends who don't need to think.
For example, the things they dislike the most,
they can tell you right away.
I think these people are very clear about what they want.
As for me, I'm not clear about it.
I'm similar to you.
When people ask me what I can't stand the most,
I would say, "I'm okay with most things."
I'm actually a bit curious.
For example, guys might say girls are materialistic,
but sometimes,
that's too broad.
Like you said, everything has a degree.
So, at what point does she become too materialistic,
and you would say, "This person is very materialistic"?
How would you describe it specifically?
For example,
she likes a certain brand of handbag
or a certain style of bag,
and she likes it because of the brand's

or she thinks the style
really suits her.
Or it could be about the design.
I don't think that's materialistic.
If she likes the bag
because everyone online thinks it's trendy,
and every girl should have one,
or having it makes her look a certain way,
then I think I understand what materialism is.
It's not about money.
It's not about how much money she has.
It's about how she views things.
I think it's about your perception of things.
It's like a philosophical perspective applied to various aspects of life.
Right, it's like that.
Yes.
That's right.
I don't even realize it.
My feeling is
that I think we are similar types of people.
Of course, we each have our differences.

I think we are quite alike.
But in terms of general principles and directions,

I feel you talk less about yourself, actually.
You are more
skilled at asking questions.
Right, that's true.
I feel that you
are better at asking questions.
Yes, both of us.

And I feel that you

I think you're someone

looking to find what you truly desire.
And if you find it,
you're pursuing it to the extreme.
I think that's great.
I think you must be someone who easily finds happiness in life.
Yes, you are easily satisfied.
Yes, I think that's good.
I think there's no more important ability than this.
This ability accompanies you throughout life.
You're happily content.
Yes, I think that's great.
I think being happily content is wonderful.
I also feel happily content, and I think it's great.
Actually, let me talk about myself first.
I actually want to talk a bit more.

there are still many things we haven't discussed.
Right?
Many things that I think we should talk about.
Right.
Many things that I'm interested in
haven't been mentioned yet.
For example, about your life,
your perspectives, right?
There are many things I think I talked about more.
Yes, about me.
I think I talked more.
Right.
Do you feel like you've been trapped today

No, it's alright.
Didn't you feel that it was quite invasive?
I'm genuinely just curious.
Actually, I wanted to ask you too.
It's about the dynamics in this kind of relationship,
the perception of dominance. But I think we can save it for our next chat.
Sure, that's fine.
Alright.
Next time, we can choose a warmer place.
Next time, maybe the weather will be warmer,
so we won't be shivering like this.
Thank you.
Thank you, take care on your way home.
Okay, goodbye.
Let's go.

Wait a moment, let me get an umbrella.
It's too cold.
Be careful.
You be careful.

Let's walk a bit slower.
I'm sorry.
It's okay.

in that cold place,
I never thought
you would choose to meet for the second time.
I mean, I feel that
there were no sparks.
I want to ask, have you been married before?
What?
